pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:0.5: 71. The training rule on walking behind
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were giving teachings to people walking in front of them. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:1.3.1: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone walking in front of me who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:1.4: One should not give a teaching to anyone walking in front of oneself who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching to someone walking in front of him who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:1.8: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:1.9: The eleventh training rule is finished.
